content:
Certainly. Here is a revised list of potential abstract features that could be used to describe the criteria in the data, with each individual feature listed separately and further divided as needed:

1. Cardiac pathology type:
* Mitral stenosis
* Mechanical valve
* Myocardial infarction
* Aneurysm of the left ventricle
* Mural thrombus in the left cavities
* Atrial fibrillation (afib)
* Atrial flutter (aflutter)
* Tachycardia-bradycardia syndrome
* Dilated cardiomyopathy
* Hypertrophic cardiomyopathy
* Endocarditis
* Intracardiac mass
* PFO
* Thrombus in situ
* Concomitant pulmonary embolism
* Proximal DVT
* Atrial septal aneurysm
* Intracardiac spontaneous echo-contrast
* Apical akinesia of the left ventricle
* Transient atrial fibrillation
* Atrial hyperexcitability
* PFO
* ASA
* Strands
* Mitral annulus calcification
* Calcification aortic valve
* Nonapical akinesia of the left ventricle
1. Cardiac pathology severity:
* Left ventricular ejection fraction
* Intracardiac mass
* Apical akinesia of the left ventricle
1. Cardiac pathology location:
* Supratentorial territorial ischemic lesions
* Infratentorial territorial ischemic lesions
* Cortical ischemic lesions
* Mural thrombus in the left cavities
* Aneurysm of the left ventricle
1. Cardiac pathology duration:
* Duration of atrial fibrillation or flutter
* Timing of myocardial infarction relative to the cerebral infarction
1. Cardiac pathology presence:
* Mitral stenosis (surface <1.5 cm^2)
* Mechanical valve
* Myocardial infarction within 4 weeks preceding the cerebral infarction
* Mural thrombus in the left cavities
* Aneurysm of the left ventricle
* History or presence of documented atrial fibrillation (paroxysmal, persistent, or permanent) or flutter, with or without left atrial thrombus or spontaneous echo
* Atrial disease (tachycardia-bradycardia syndrome)
* Dilated or hypertrophic cardiomyopathies
* Left ventricle ejection fraction <35%
* Endocarditis
* Intracardiac mass
* PFO and thrombus in situ
* PFO and concomitant pulmonary embolism or proximal DVT preceding the index cerebral infarction
1. Cardiac pathology evaluation:
* ECG
* TEE
* TTE
* Cardiac CT
* Cardiac MRI
* Abdominal CT
* Abdominal MRI

I have removed the causality grade feature as requested. Let me know if there are any other changes you would like to make to the list.
